taskDescription:
Suppose you have datasets <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>x</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">x</annotation></semantics></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>y</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">y</annotation></semantics></math> with the following statistics: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>x</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">x</annotation></semantics></math> has mean 100 and standard deviation 5, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>y</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">y</annotation></semantics></math> has mean 200 and standard deviation 20, and their correlation coefficient is 0.75. What’s the equation of the regression line?
